value.name: The trauma of the teen who filmed Floyd’s murder
value.description: Darnella Frazier’s cellphone footage of George Floyd’s arrest last May helped rewrite the story of his death, then arguably became the “star witness” in a police officer's conviction for murder.

value.name: In photos: Minneapolis rallies for George Floyd ahead of 1st anniversary of his killing
value.description: Members of George Floyd's family and civil rights leaders led a remembrance rally and march in his honor in Minneapolis, Minnesota, Sunday — the first of three days of activities marking the first anniversary of his death.

value.name: Photo gallery: After George Floyd, unrest, reckonings, dreams
value.description: The little daughter of the murdered Minnesotan said her father, in his suffering, had “changed the world.” Those tracking the stubborn arc of our racist history can only hope she’s right.

value.name: President Joe Biden To Host George Floyd's Family At White House
value.description: President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris will host members of George Floyd's family at the White House Tuesday, marking the one-year anniversary of Floyd's death while in the hands of Minneapolis police.

value.name: George Floyd's Brother Urges Congress to Pass Police Reform on One-Year Anniversary of His Death
value.description: "People shouldn't have to live in fear," Philonise Floyd told CNN. "African American people, people of color, they are dying at a rate that we shouldn't have in this world."

value.name: In photos: Protesters rally across U.S. and the world over Israeli–Palestinian conflict
value.description: Thousands of people rallied across the U.S. and the world Saturday following days of violence in Gaza and Israel that's killed at least 145 Palestinians, including 41 children, and eight Israelis, per AP.

value.name: George Floyd's Brother Urges Americans to 'Stay Woke' Ahead of Anniversary
value.description: "To keep this movement flourishing, to keep my brother's name ringing in the ears of everyone," Terrence Floyd said at a gathering ahead of the one-year anniversary of his brother's murder.
